On Fri, Nov 29, 2024 at 5:53 PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
wrote:

> Hello Aman,
>
> I wanted to check in regarding your support ticket 00413035. We haven’t
> heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need
> assistance with this issue.
>
> If you’re still experiencing problems or have any updates to share, please
> let me know. If the issue has been resolved, I can go ahead and close the
> ticket on my end.
>
> Please feel free to reply to this email with any updates or questions.
> We’re here to help you get the most out of your Netwrix products.
>
> *Ticket Number:* 00413035
> *Ticket Subject:* DLP Agent is creating excessive cache in system Extern
> *Ticket Details:* Hi team,
>
> I'm opening a support case on behalf of the customer Easebuzz as they are
> experiencing the below issue described by the customer:
>
> "DLP agents are making excessive cache in systems, and because of that,
> our systems are getting slow. We uninstalled the agent from a couple of
> systems and monitored it for a week, and no excessive cache file was there.
> Once we install the agent, we get the cache files in surplus.
>
> Kindly please help us with that. We need a reason for that and a way to
> stop that from happening."
>
> Thank you!
>
> Thank you!
>
> Andrei Pop
> Technical Support Engineer
> ____________________ _________
> *Cybersecurity That Works for You*
>
> 6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
> www.netwrix.com
